actions.label: Read Gravestone
actions.text:
Ulinir
Of the Pine
Nature's Strength

npcs.name: Acting Lieutenant Germain
utterances: Welcome, citizen. Please be careful around here.

Yes, quite dangerous. We have been getting reports, strange reports, over the past few days. Nobody is sure exactly what is going on, and we don't have the manpower to find out once and for all. I've got scouts but even they can only do so much. We've got so few people that it's hard to take care of all the little things.  Ever since the pirates landed the Concordium has been asking for more and more protection.

More than you know. With dead-end investigations, big threats, little threats, and vague orders from the Qeynos Guard AND the Concordium I'm amazed this place hasn't been put under siege by the hawks yet. I'm sorry for complaining to you. Listen, how would you like to help me out?

Good, that's great news. The first thing I'd like you to do is help me locate a missing scout. Del Varun was assigned to the small pond on the western side of the ruins. He hasn't checked back in and hasn't been spotted in a few days. I'd like you to head that direction and see if you can find him.
Don't be foolish. Don't get yourself hurt, but if you notice anything that might lead us to him please let me know about it.
What is it, citizen?
Alright, let's see. Hmm, you say you found this here? As in the Forest Ruins?
This is disturbing. This looks like gnollish. It may be some random coincidence or the gnolls may be on the move, and Qeynos isn't sending anymore guards out here for the time being.
Any news of Del Varun yet?
Only his satchel? I was afraid of this. I wish we had some leads, he may yet be alive.
Ah, good thinking. Did you see the glowing too? Perhaps it was a transitory thing.
Incredible. Please, take this to Poko Zing over there. Have him analyze it for us.
I don't know, but I'm hoping Poko will be able to tell us.
Welcome back. Are you ready for some more work?
It was part of an illusion. Poko made up some kind of dust that he says can dispel the illusion for short periods of time. So, it's time for us to figure out what someone has been trying to hide.
Find out what those plants are hiding. I'd like you to take Poko's dust and go sprinkle it on the plants. Try to bring back some kind of clue if at all possible, I doubt it will all be nailed down.
Plans would help the most. Some paper or a book or something of the kind.
Well?
Gnolls... was there anything else other than the book?

That is quite unfortunate. The diagrams in this book look like they involve digging tools and machines. Thi- wait a minute! According to these plans the gnolls have digging tools stored all over the place! They are probably under the same magical veil as the camp.
No, but we need to stop them. I need you to go back out around the ruins. Find these hidden digging tools, sprinkle some of Poko's powder on them, and destroy them.
We'll drive these gnolls out yet!  Thanks for helping.
Have you destroyed the tools?

Good, good. I've been going over this book of theirs. These gnolls seem to be only one group of many currently on the move. I believe we can stop the ones here if we take out their leader. We can worry about the others later, or never. I've sent word to Qeynos, it is unlikely they will require any assistance from us. For now, how would you like to attempt something important?

I know you can. A gnoll named Malox seems to be leading the gnolls around here. If we take him out, the rest will scatter. He will likely be near their hidden camp. They know we're on to them but they will not have had time to move their camp yet. Go there and light their tent on fire, that ought to bring Malox out! Once he emerges, kill him.
Be safe.
Malox?

Good. Very good. Well done. This is a huge relief. With Malox gone the other gnolls won't last much longer, at least the ones here won't. <player name>, Qeynos has sent word back. The Rockpaw Gnolls are responsible for what has happened here. It is time to move.

We have gone on the offensive. The Rockpaw Gnolls have made their base within The Caves for quite some time, and we've decided to attack. Travel there and speak with Consul Bree, she will have orders for you. Thanks again, <player name>, you really came through for us out here.
I wish I could go with you into the Caves. Good luck.
Thank you again for all you've done.

npcs.name: Aedre
utterances: Go on, take a look at the stock.  You'll never beat this price in the city.  I guarantee it!

npcs.name: a Blackfurl deckhand
utterances: Sees us, did we? Must not let you talk then.
Don't hurt us! We're no threat to your mightiness.
Time to leave, yes. Definitely time to leave.
I can't hold them forever!
You'll pay for that one, peon!
That patch of fur will never grow back, you know.
Flee and take care of them later.
I'm gonna give you a smile like ol' one tooth!
Neat, that'll leave a pretty scar
Is this supposed to hurt?
Feel kinda sleepy. Whacha do to me?
I will have vengeance!
I hope you put your affairs in order.

npcs.name: a Blackfurl lubber
utterances: I hope you put your affairs in order.
Look what strolled into the spider's web!
There is no escape for you now!

npcs.name: a Blackfurl medic
utterances: Not nice to interrupt dinner.
I'm gonna give you a smile like ol' one tooth!
Me going to eat your kidney first.
Come back you coward! I'm not dead yet.
Neat, that'll leave a pretty scar
Feel kinda sleepy. Whacha do to me?

npcs.name: a Blackfurl oarcaller
utterances: Fall back and regroup.  The enemy has the upper hand!

npcs.name: a Blackfurl scout
utterances: Flee and take care of them later.
Should of escaped while I had the chance.
Not very nice of you to be all sneaky.
Take my secrets to my grave, I shall.

npcs.name: a Blackfurl swabbie
utterances: Sees us, did we? Must not let you talk then.
Startle us, you did! We'll remedy that.
That patch of fur will never grow back, you know.
Now I'm really angry!
Flee and take care of them later.
Not nice to interrupt dinner.
Is that all you have?
I'm gonna give you a smile like ol' one tooth!
Neat, that'll leave a pretty scar

npcs.name: a brittle accountant
utterances: My progress will not be halted!
You cannot defeat us all!

npcs.name: Dig Supervisor T'narl
utterances: Look what strolled into the spider's web!

npcs.name: Elvic Garrett
utterances: These lands are not as safe as they once were.
Ah, this is fortuitious. It has been some time since Daelyn has written something. My mind has been occupied as of late, I may have to save reading this for a time when I can focus more on my people.
My mind is occupied with these lands. Something is off, though I know not what. I offered my assistance to the Qeynos guard, but haven't turned up anything yet.

Perhaps you can. I've been patrolling the land around the ruins lately, occasionally I come across abandoned camps. Usually a fire pit or a collection of firewood that hasn't yet been burnt. Sometimes these abandoned camps have what may end up being clues, other times they contain worthless junk. If you could do me the favor of seeking out these camps it may help unwravel the mystery that is going on here.
Thank you.  I am sure this will be very helpful.
Have you found any clues yet?

Hm, let me see that. Hmm, this note is written in gnollish. This... the Qeynos Guard needs to know of this, immediately. You must take this to Lieutenant Germain, he will know what to do. Offer him whatever help you can. And... thank you.
Well you certainly proved what you were made of. Good job! If only Qeynos had more citizens like you.

npcs.name: Ilaen Lilac
utterances: There is no failing greater than a child unable to protect a parent.

npcs.name: Outlander Vaughn
utterances: Am I ever in a bind! Will you please help me?
Those wretched Blackfurl deckhands stole my satchel!  It had everything that was important to me. Please, recover my satchel!
What's that you have? You found my stuff!  That's fantastic!  I can't thank you enough.
Thank you so very much for finding my dear possessions! Can you help me with one more small favor?
I need you to take this letter to Hunter Forestdeep. You'll find him in the Willow Wood village.

npcs.name: Poko Zing
utterances: How come nobody seems to realize how busy I am? Let me guess, you want me to do something very boring for your benefit, am I right?
Analyze? Why wo- ooh, is it glowing? This is an amazing find. Where DID you find it?
How precise! Er, well I can do these tests but I'm going to need you to finish what I was working on in the interim.

I'm looking for a reason for the activity around here lately, the sudden interest. Who knows, maybe this leaf will prove to be that reason. But, I won't abandon my other theories. As such I'd like you to collect bark samples from the trees around here. My theory is--well that's not important. I need bark samples from trees both outside and inside the ruins, as well as from both north and south of the river that runs through them. I would also like some rock samples from the ruins.
Do you have my requested materials yet?
Good, give them to me.

Oh, right. The leaf wasn't real at all. It was part of some sort of illusion. The plant it came from was meant to hide something. I've already told all of this to Lieutenant Germain, go talk to him, I'm busy.
I am very, very busy. Please respect that.

npcs.name: a rotting pathfinder
utterances: Your blood calls to me.

npcs.name: Sergeant at Arms Uthros
utterances: Watch your step, friend. Many adventurers get injured because they don't know the dangers that lurk here. These grounds are home to the ruins of the old mage academy.  It was destroyed during the wars that raged centuries ago.  And aside from the already dangerous inhabitants of these ruins,  elemental servants of mages lurk about. Scared yet? ... If you're intent on staying in Qeynos, I suppose we can use your help.
Well, then, make yourself useful and kill some of the nasty vermin who live in this area.   And if you need something to do later, come on back, I always need help!
Hey! Great work on the vermin.  Can you spare more time to help Qeynos?
Great! Then go and kill more vermin.

npcs.name: a sleepless one
utterances: My progress will not be halted!
Do not disturb me!
I am weakening!

npcs.name: a sodden victim
utterances: Dying didn't feel good the first time.
That pile of bones was my friend!
As I rise from the grave,  you will now take my place!
Seek death and it finds you.
Your eyes are so pretty.

npcs.name: a spectral student
utterances: Time to teach you a lesson about disturbing the dead!
You shall regret waking the dead.
You invoke my wrath.
I will not miss a second time!
Fascinating, you can actually damage me!

npcs.name: Thenatren Lightarrow
utterances: Watch yourself near those ruins, they are dangerous!
Careful near those ruins friend!  It's a magical place and full of danger!

npcs.name: Therven Senshun
utterances: Hello there! Have you got time to lend a hand?

Well, I'm trying some new leather tanning methods and in my work I've found that some of my techniques create an amazingly soft product when used on turtle shells. Amazing, I know! I'm not sure what use it may have, but I'd like to perfect the process anyway.
Well, this process is delicate and requires a lot of time. That means that I'm unable to hunt the turtles around here. If you could hunt them for me I would be grateful.

Excellent! If you could get me six leathershell snapper shells and six stoneshell snapper shells I think that would be enough to finalize this process. You can find them in the pond north west of here.
Bring them back as soon as you get them!
Did you get the shells?
Thanks! I appreciate it! You've really helped me a lot.
This stuff is much harder to work with than I anticipated.
